website_summaries.verdict: An herb-free version of the popular Baby & Me whole foods multivitamin.
pros: Versatile and can be used as both a pre- and postnatal vitamin
Consumers also experienced improved hair and nail growth
cons: Missing vitamins like calcium and magnesium
Minor complaints of nausea, though was gentle on the stomach for most

customer_reviews.title: Excellent results
customer_reviews.text: My wife has taken this supplement during the pregnancy and during breastfeeding for our first child and the results have been spectacular. Our son is much smarter than his peers. He is a master builder with blocks and his he says more words than I do and he’s 2. He is also the most handsome child anyone has ever seen. He was doing the “Blue steel” as he came out of the birth canal. Amazing. Very happy with the results of this supplement! Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle D

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had been ordering this prenatal through Amazon off and on for a few months but this last time all of the packaging was extremely suspicious - see photos. The seal was dirty and clear plastic - not the green printed trademark seal that is on genuine mega foods products. I can’t believe how scary this is and I’m so happy I noticed this and didn’t take any of the pills. I can’t even begin to imagine what could be in those pills. I will never buy supplements from Amazon again. The seller these came from was called NetRush.
customer_reviews.author: E.S.

customer_reviews.title: 59 tablets not 60
customer_reviews.text: I love these vitamins because they are the only ones that don’t make me throw up. It’s such a relief to actually be able to eat and not loose weight while pregnant. Despite loving the vitamins I have to give them a 3 because I’ve ordered these bottles twice and each time there were 59 tablets instead of 60. At first I thought maybe I took an extra one one day so I ordered again and counted. This sucks because you’re supposed to take 2 a day and on the last day you can only take one. -_-.....really? I know that’s something minor but it’s really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Finally a pre/post natal with FOLATE, instead of "folic acid" which the body can't even digest. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel C

customer_reviews.title: Healthy baby and momma
customer_reviews.text: While I cannot say that my daughter and I are healthy because of these prenatal vitamins, I did start taking these prenatals along with a prenatal DHA (because these pills do not have DHA) when my husband and I started planning to conceive. My daughter is now four months old, and she is very healthy, well adjusted, and mentally alert. I plan to continue taking these vitamins until I stop breastfeeding. I have read that it is recommend to take folic acid *before* you conceive, so start taking prenatals now - if possible - if you are planning to become pregnant. I am happy with my prenatal choices, I just wish they were less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Huschitt

customer_reviews.title: Formula change, causing reaction
customer_reviews.text: These worked really well for me during my first pregnancy. It was the 1 prenatal/ multi vitamin I found that I didnt react to. I started taking them again in preparation and I can feel the effects of the changes they made to the formula. It caused me fatigue, acne, dry mouth and dizziness. I am not preggo at the moment so it's not pregnancy symptoms. It would be nice if they could be more honest about formula changes rather than dancing around the issue and pretending that they only changed the labeling to meet the FDA requirements because that's putting the health of babies and mom at stake.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Lujan

customer_reviews.title: **MUST READ**
customer_reviews.text: These pills don’t contain DHA (omega 3/fish oil) which I didn’t realize I needed until 28 weeks pregnant. My doctor failed to tell me I’d need an additional supplement when she looked at these pills/the ingredients so I’m just now finding out. These pills are great but you will need to take an additional DHA supplement in conjunction with this prenatal. Hope this helps and you don’t find out in your third trimester like me :)
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Great vitamins, but one capsule looks moldy.
customer_reviews.text: I took these vitamins at the end of my first pregnancy, and took them again throughout my second pregnancy and so far while breastfeeding. I’ve never had an issue, but I found what looks like a moldy capsule in my most recent bottle. I’ve requested a replacement and hope to not have a similar issue!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah H.

customer_reviews.title: Must for breastfeeding moms
customer_reviews.text: I ended up without these for 7 days and by the 4th day I was feeling absolutely exhausted. I hadn't changed anything else in my diet, vitamin, or breastfeeding routine and I was falling asleep mid-day. I ordered again Sunday and they just got here (Wednesday) which makes shipping a bit long when they should've been 2 day Prime, for that reason I've deducted a star.
customer_reviews.author: Mortar Wife

customer_reviews.title: Great if you’re TTC, avoid if you’re not TTC
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been taking these vitamins for the last 3 months because they were recommended as a hair growth aid (I cut my hair very short last winter and am anxious to grow it quickly). I have no interest in having kids at this point in my life and was certain that I was infertile after failed attempts to conceive in my mid-20’s. Yesterday I found out I’m pregnant for the first time and I can’t think of any other thing that I’ve been doing differently than taking these vitamins (I smoke cigarettes, drink fairly often, not the healthiest eater). So yeah, it’s not great considering my situation but I highly recommend this for those TTC.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Does not upset my stomach
customer_reviews.text: I have been taking the prenatal vitamins for 5 months now. I'm preparing for IVF. These do not upset my stomach at all. I take 1 in the morning and 1 at night. It is a bit large, but if you take it with a glass of milk or juice, it is much easier to swallow.
customer_reviews.author: Davy Crockett Murray

customer_reviews.title: I’d recommend it to anyone not just trying to conceive or ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to get very exhausted without do anything at all, had all my labs done at the doctors and was told repeatedly my labs were normal. With rest, drinking a lot of water, eating healthy and working out didn’t quite do it until I discovered MegaFood Baby and me. I’d recommend it to anyone not just trying to conceive or status post conception... this is my multivitamin and am enjoying the new youthful me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is probably one of the best food based vitamins out in the market
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the best food based vitamins out in the market. We did a ton of research deciding what goes in and this was the winner. It is certainly on the expensive side, but the difference was easily noticeable while I skipped couple days waiting for a new bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer Service

customer_reviews.title: Nice prenatal vitamins
customer_reviews.text: Didn't help with my low platelets or anemia. I had previously taken the Baby and Me prenatals for my previous pregnancy and had low platelet counts so with this pregnancy I had seen this Baby and Me 2 would help more if you have anemia during your pregnancy. I tried it and didn't get a different outcome the levels stayed the same as my previous pregnancy and I actually this time was also diagnosed with anemia as well. I still liked the vitamins and recommended this brand. They are a little difficult to swallow and sometimes I would get a little nauseous afterwards but nothing extreme.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Great product, however I’m allergic!
customer_reviews.text: Quite honestly I wanted to love this product. Overall I do feel it to be a great prenatal vitamin with lots of research completed and safe for use. Unfortunately, I itch between my breasts and under them CONSTANTLY while taking this vitamin. I haven’t yet been able to pinpoint what is causing my reaction but when I stop taking them, the itch goes away. Last pregnancy I thought it was just hormones and took this religiously. This time I’ve figured it out early and am sadly having to try other prenatal vitamins in lieu of this product. Hopefully this review helps others if they’re experiencing similar issues.
customer_reviews.author: Merritt L. Tongen

customer_reviews.title: The best prenatal out there!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best prenatal vitamin out there! I’ve been a supplement buyer/consultant for years and this performs the best with customers, and personally! You can take it on an empty stomach, it doesn’t make you nauseous, and if you have a hard time swallowing pills you can crush it up and mix it with juice. They are also one of the only few companies that is 100% whole food based, so what you are ingesting your body happily absorbs.
customer_reviews.author: Turquoise

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Used these my whole pregnancy. Never got a stomach ache, felt great my entire pregnancy and all my bloodwork came out great the entire time. The pills are big so if you have issues swallowing that could be a problem. Also if you let it sit in ur mouth there is a taste- but that is normal IMO. I recommend these and they are worth paying extra for. No need to go cheap for ur baby:)
customer_reviews.author: Pomona Gold

customer_reviews.title: Had blood tested for vitamins.
customer_reviews.text: How do you KNOW for sure a vitamin is working? Well I’ve been following the keto diet while preparing for my next pregnancy. Not a lot of leafy green etc. so I went and had my blood tested. Doctor said my B-12 and folate were perfect. That’s had to be from the vitamins. My iron was low. So I need to supplement but I think I’ve just always had low iron. Just thought I’d share that these pills made my levels good. I took the Raw prenatal from garden of life for my first pregnancy but heard a lot of bad things about them since then. I like that these have choline. That to me means they are COMPLETE!
customer_reviews.author: Stefane

customer_reviews.title: Best prenatal and postnatal vitamin
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this product. I use this throughout my whole pregnancy and also during breastfeeding. All the vitamins and minerals in this is from naturally derived sources. Normal vitamins on the market make me nauseous (I think this is because they have folic acid and not folate like this product), these vitamins do not make me nauseous. I prefer this one to the regular baby and me because you only need to take two pills a day and it doesn't have all the additional herbs which I just take through t anyways. I suggest this to all expecting namas and breastfeeding mamas.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle Millares

customer_reviews.title: Best prenatal on the market.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent prenatal vitamin. We did extensive research on which prenatal to choose, and this is hands down the best one. I’ve always had problems with nausea when taking prenatals but not at all with this one. Yes, there is a little bit of a vitamin taste when you put them in your mouth, but it instantly washes down with whatever liquid you’re taking it with. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: I do NOT RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.text: Headaches galore... I absolutely would not recommend. I’ve tried the books builder which is excellent, and tried D3 mega food which is good. But this wasn’t up to my expectations. And mine are moldy as well!!🤮
customer_reviews.author: porscha

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this
customer_reviews.text: It really works wonder. I did not have any morning sickness, no cravings, no negative pregnancy symptoms like headache, moodswing, etc. I believe bec of this prenatal vits. I felt the same before i was pregnant except my tummy kept growing. Me and baby were both healthy. My hair stopped falling out while taking this. But once i stopped taking this bec im done breastfeeding, one week later, my hair started to shed a LOOOOTTTT again. I believe in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jw

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Best prenatal vitamin!! I had such an easy pregnancy and I credit it all to taking the right vitamins. Didn't have any cravings, discomfort or swelling while on this pill. After I paired it with high quality DHA, "pregnancy brain" symptoms went away as well. Overall a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite vitamin!
customer_reviews.text: I started taking these in anticipation of starting a family and they have been wonderful so far! They don't make me nauseous, which many other vitamins do. Even on an empty stomach these vitamins are totally fine for me! I also love knowing that they are made from great, natural ingredients! I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Robyn

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like these!
customer_reviews.text: I truly wanted to like these prenatals. Unfortunately after about a week of taking these, I started feeling very "off". Super tired but anxious at the same time if it makes any sense. In addition it caused constipation. Sorry TMI! But I want to be honest about my experience. I didn't have any nausea or upset stomach from them. Definitely easy on the stomach. After I stopped taking these for two days I start to feel back to my normal pregnant self.
customer_reviews.author: yourmom

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: At my 2 month and postpartum visit, my OBGYN’s PA said that I didn’t need to continue taking my prenatal (I should have researched my questions further). After 6 months without a prenatal, my babe is in the 98 percentile and I have felt like the walking dead: low energy, frustrated, emotional, pale skin, etc. After starting this prenatal, I’m starting to regain my strength and look and FEEL healthy and nourished again.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Look no further!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best multivitamin, and I feel like I’ve tried them all. It is really easy on the stomach, and I like that it’s made from real food. Taking 2 pills seems annoying in the beginning, especially because the pills are big, but you get used to it and it is SO worth it for such a great vitamin.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Wholesome and encompassing while breastfeeding
customer_reviews.text: I take these as a postnatal while breastfeeding and they do us both real well. Gentle on our stomachs and from the research I've done, contain most of the necessary vitamins and minerals needed while breastfeeding. I take calcium, vitamin D, and omega-3s with them. These were also found to be the lowest in lead and arsenic among prenatals.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Best whole food pre- and post-natal vitamin around!
customer_reviews.text: I've been taking these vitamins for almost three years. I love that they are made from whole foods and do not contain any pesticides, herbicides, and GMOs. I used to purchase the original Baby & Me but switched to the Baby & Me II because of some controversy surrounding the safety of consuming the herbs while pregnant and the price tag. A bottle of Baby & Me II last two months which comes out to about $25-$27 a month.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: This hits the Fancy Mama Bear spot.
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find a supplement that doesn't go overboard on some vitamin or another, and when they do a good job at that it seems like they're mostly packed with extracts and essences of this or that. The price is a shame because it would not be that hard to just leave all the extras out of your offering... but nobody does it. This vitamin comes close, so I have to give them props.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin G.

customer_reviews.title: Good Prental-No issues
customer_reviews.text: I started taking these with my 3rd pregnancy, and have continued with them through breastfeeding. I switched from Garden of Life. I didn’t have any complaints with my previous brand, but decided to try Megafood instead. I have had no issues with these. The pill size is reasonable, in my opinion. Although those who have a hard time swallowing pills or are currently dealing with morning sickness may encounter an issue. I take the daily serving of these (2 pills) along with the Nordic Natural DHA.
customer_reviews.author: mommyof3

customer_reviews.title: Good prenatal!
customer_reviews.text: I've been taking this Megafood prenatal throughout my whole pregnancy, and for a while after. Super happy very with them. This is great if you're looking for a prenatal with methylfolate. I actually started out with the normal Baby & Me then switched to the Baby & Me 2, because it wasn't entirely clear to me if the Baby & Me had active folate, plus I decided I'd rather not have the extra herbal stuff in it. They never seemed to bother my stomach!
customer_reviews.author: Rose B.

customer_reviews.title: Finally a multivitamin I can take!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried several multivitamins during my pregnancy but they all made me nauseous except this one by MegaFood. I don’t love the flavor but there’s no way any one can make a vitamin taste better without artificial ingredients. Besides that I love these vitamins. I noticed I had more energy, was in a better mood, and even my hair started looking healthier after I started these. I highly recommend trying them.
customer_reviews.author: Jyeager

customer_reviews.title: absolutely recommended
customer_reviews.text: my wife started with these ones and they are great... everything she and our baby needs! We bought it for pre and postnatal use. So clever they didn't add calcium because of the absorption of the iron, and also they are kosher with a very high quality process! ps: iron flavor is one thing my wife doesn't like too much but she says is not a big deal
customer_reviews.author: Juan Jose

customer_reviews.title: Helped Quell Morning Sickness
customer_reviews.text: I was taking a different vitamin for the beginning 8 weeks of pregnancy as well as while trying to conceive and had no issues. About half way through my 8th week the nausia hit me. I read that capsule pills can be harsher on the stomach because they dissolve quickly and hit your stomach all at once. So I tried these thinking a solid pill would be better because they'd dissolve slower and they've worked like a charm! Will definitely continue taking these for the remainder of my pregnancy and post natal!
customer_reviews.author: Krysty Condon

customer_reviews.title: Best after extensive research
customer_reviews.text: Used these my whole pregnancy and had the best pregnancy ever, not much symptoms. Healthy moma healthy baby. FAST labor! Yet again it could always be each person is different but I did extensive research and these were the best also have to buy DHA apart of these! Also I recommend drinking the pink stork 1-2 months before delivery. I had a 5 minute delivery lol so MAYBE it was these products IDK but worth a try!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Hoffmann

customer_reviews.title: Nutritious but TERRIBLE taste!
customer_reviews.text: I did lots of research before deciding on these as a prenatal. I saw some other reviews about the taste but I still wasn't prepared for the horrific, fizzy taste of these! I tried several methods: breaking into pieces; chewing with a mouthful of food; grinding up and putting into flavored yogurt; grinding up and putting into orange juice; etc. After a while I couldn't even eat the yogurt and other foods plain because I was so turned off after trying them with these pills ground up in them. I had to switch to a different prenatal and only got about 1/4 way into this bottle. Just thinking about these giant pills still makes my cheeks tingle.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great ingredients for a developing fetus
customer_reviews.text: I started taking these a month prior to when we ended up conceiving. They are big and taste very sour if you leave them on your tongue for too long. I haven’t been hit with horrible morning sickness yet, so I can’t say how tolerable they will be. For right now, I am happy with them and I love they wholesome ingredients inside. This is the best price I have found anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Berkeley C

customer_reviews.title: Pills are hard to swallow
customer_reviews.text: The regular prenatal pills I've been taking wasn't unavailable so I opted for this one. It is really hard to swallow with a sour flavor to them. The ingredients seem good and the percentage of vitamins are fit for a relatively healthy eater. However, I'm not a healthier eater and needed more. I wasn't that impressed with the prenatal and so will look to other sources to fill my order for the one I took before.
customer_reviews.author: Stevaño

customer_reviews.title: Yuck!!
customer_reviews.text: I was so impressed by the quality of the ingredients. I had read some reviews that these were harder to swallow and not the best taste but figured I’d give it a try. This vitamin tastes horrible! It’s like salty dog food. It’s a taste that lingers too. I’m really sad because I really wanted to love these. For something comparable, I’ve taken the rainbow prenatals which were similar in size and texture and that taste was barely noticeable compared to these.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Stinky, Yucky & Healthy
customer_reviews.text: This contains such good quality ingredients, but I gagged and threw up many times when I tried to take them because the smell and taste is just like really smelly dog food! Since I’m in my first trimester I’m probably more sensitive, so I got a gummy vitamin and am saving the rest of these tablets til later on when I might not throw up when tryna take them!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Oppizzi

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but quantity issue.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these prenatal pills. Good quality ingredients, but quantity is never right. This is the second time I bought them, and the number of vitamins hasn’t been accurate. Hoping third bottle is the charm, since I ordered two this time. This bottle should have 60 vitamins but there was only 57 and a half. I first only saw the half and was like, oh it must have broke in transport, but there was not another half of the pill in the bottle. So I counted them because last time, I was shorted. It happened again. This sucks. I may have to try another prenatal next time. Even though I really like these.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly Smith

customer_reviews.title: Drink with something to mask strong smell
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like the after-taste or sour heartburn that comes later and I have stomach issues from these. At first, it was hard to tell for weeks from where my stomach was hurting and I was running to the bathroom, but now I know for sure it’s from the vitamins.
customer_reviews.author: Vita Marks

customer_reviews.title: My favorite
customer_reviews.text: Before I purchased these I had bought another brand. The other brand made me feel so much worse. I hated the after taste it left as well. These are pretty pricey but my body tolerated them well. I never did take the 4 recommend, I would only take 3.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Great quality prenatal
customer_reviews.text: I am a dietitian so I did extensive research for the “perfect” prenatal and this one was the closest one to fitting the bill. Although there are a few missing vitamins (calcium & omega 3), the quality and sources of the vitamins and minerals are of quality. I also like how this prenatal is gelatin-free.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Quality vitamin
customer_reviews.text: With these you have to make sure you put the cotton back in the bottle every time to preserve freshness or they start to brown . I like that they don't have some coating that prevents easy absorption. They're small enough to swallow, but the only thing that makes it hard to take is how strong the vitamin taste is. I generally have the same issues with other pills, so it's not a con, just a preference. Over all I like this vitamin.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Nakano

customer_reviews.title: Very scary
customer_reviews.text: Caused me to have HORRIBLE HIVES ...do not buy these!!! 😭😭😭
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Great for pregnancy but sour when going down
customer_reviews.text: I am 23 weeks pregnant with my first baby. I have been taking these pills my entire pregnancy because I found these to be some of the most natural pills from what I researched. I have to say these pills do not make me nauseous and do what they are supposed to. Over my pregnancy it's been harder to take them because of the sour taste as they go down but I believe that is just because of my stomach during pregnancy. I normally don't have any issues taking pills. I have had to break them in half to make it easier but it's still not a huge deal. I will continue to take these and see how they do.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Would 100% recommend if your morning sickness isnt terrible
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite prenatal because it has such great, thoughtful ingredients. It has methylfolate, which is what I was looking for. It does not contain calcium, because it has iron in it, so you may have to take an additional supplement. The flavor is strong and the pills are large, so it did not work well in my first trimester with morning sickness, but I took it prior to conceiving and am back with them in the 2nd trimester. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: 20 Something

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had any problems with this vitamin. The taste horrible but what do you expect from this kind of natural pill. It’s food pulp. Pills are massive but I manage. 5 star for the ingredients. I can’t find this amount of choline in any other pill.
customer_reviews.author: XannaBaby

customer_reviews.title: Excellent dairy and soy free vitamin! Great for breastfeeding moms!
customer_reviews.text: These vitamins are wonderful! They are dairy and soy free, which is great as my daughter and I both have a dairy allergy! I’m a breastfeeding mom and I was experiencing an iron & vitamin D deficiency. Within about 1 week of taking them, I started to feel much better! They are large pills but it’s great that I can take them in an empty stomach without issues!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: I just started taking it for about a few days now. I’m not pregnant but I’ve been losing my hair so I decided to start myself on prenatals since my biotin pills are not doing the job as effectively as I want it to. The pills def make me feel a little nauseous and I’m not even pregnant. If anything changes I’ll write an update.
customer_reviews.author: Prissy

customer_reviews.title: Good if you have low iron/anemic
customer_reviews.text: I started taking this vitamin abouy 4 months ago. During my pregnancy I had blood drawn that showed high levels of iron in my blood. I already had normal iron levels prior to taking this vitamin, but since the absorption level with this vitamin is so good it made my levels high. High levels of iron is unheard of during pregnancy, so if you are looking for a vitamin that will boost your iron this is definitely the one for you! Just becareful if your iron levels are already normal to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ultrababy
customer_reviews.text: As long as you're not a cry baby about swallowing pills like most of the women on here then you're fine. I thought these were easy to get down, smell is fine, and they definitely helped boost me through pregnancy. If my child is a genius I'll give them another 5 stars .
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: Helps to create super babies :)
customer_reviews.text: This was amazing and still is. I used it in combination with other supplements during my pregnancy and my son is super healthy, big, and advanced. I’m not really sure how much a multivitamin can contribute to intelligence, but my Son has been markedly more advanced and is very intelligent/aware for his age, even our ped was shocked. I continue to use these during nursing, he’s now 4 months old. I will definitely use these again next time!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Dunfee

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I used to take a different brand of prenatal which is also high quality (won't name the other manufacturer). I switched to this because the other manufacturer I was using the prenatal I was on was on back-order. I did my research and read the reviews and researched the company, everything seemed to check out. I have been taking this for a week now and I already notice a difference, I have more energy, my nails are growing, and it doesn't cause stomach upset or nausea. I will continue to take this through my pregnancy and during breastfeeding!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Acidic and Sour taste
customer_reviews.text: I subscribed without trying it. Very big tablets with a horrible sour taste. I guess that is good in a way it makes you drink more water. Granted, All prenatal vitamins are big, but the acid sour taste is hard to cope with. Oh great I just noticed, you are supposed to take it twice a day. I am going to cancel now. I would say try it first before subscribing.
customer_reviews.author: Lingee

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend-allergy friendly
customer_reviews.text: The price is NOT high, you get two months worth! Do the math. Great product. I breastfeed and had to go non-dairy and no soy. Little did I know, my old vitamins had soy so I switched to these. They remind me of kid flinstone vitamin taste (before I swallow them with water), it makes my mouth water for some reason. I’ll continue to purchase these from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Warnali

customer_reviews.title: I Keep Coming Back For More
customer_reviews.text: I love that this is a vitamin made from food and it’s only two pills to take a day. My other whole food vitamins are smaller but the serving suggestion is three a day. Mega Food Baby and Me too doesn’t irritate my stomach or give me a headache. Those are issues that I’ve found with other brands. I’ve even been able to take them on an empty stomach. I’ve also recommend them and will recommend them again.
customer_reviews.author: MAL

customer_reviews.title: Gentle on the stomach
customer_reviews.text: I took these through my whole pregnancy and while I was nursing. They never gave me heartburn or nausea, even on an empty stomach. I didn’t get vitamin burps, either. They use high quality ingredients and can be taken either twice or four times a day, depending if you buy the me or me 2. Love these. Taking them now in prep for the next one!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Healthy baby!
customer_reviews.text: Well, our baby was born healthy and smart. What more would you like to know? 😊
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Butcher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Prenatal - Healthy Baby and Mom
customer_reviews.text: Love and trust the ingredients in this product - especially because of the bioavailability. I previously had a son with minor birth defects so I was determined to get the right kind of folate and needed it to be food based. I like that you can take it without food. Took this throughout my pregnancy and now postpartum. Happy to report that I had good energy, the baby was healthy, no jaundice, nothing... and now I can tell a difference if I don't take my them. They give me good energy, skin, hair nails, and I have avoided anemia too.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Gag reflex
customer_reviews.text: During pregnancy, my gag reflex was worse than normal and this pill made me throw up so many times. It was terrible trying to swallow it during my first trimester. I cut them all in half which made it much better.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn S.

customer_reviews.title: I am loving this prenatal vitamin!
customer_reviews.text: I switched from another food-based supplement and felt a difference almost immediately upon switching to this one. I was craving beef, which is really rare for me, so I knew that I needed iron and this helped right away. I also love that it has methylated Bs and less vitamin A.
customer_reviews.author: Tiff

customer_reviews.title: Nice product!
customer_reviews.text: I like it so much. I was taking new chapter before I bought this and this one feels much easier to absorb. The only thing not perfect is the flavor not that nice. but I take it with water, it does not Give me much difficult time. Overall, this is really recommended to pre-moms.
customer_reviews.author: Cherrie Z.

customer_reviews.title: Palpitations in my heart increased my blood pressure
customer_reviews.text: This is the account of my husband but I bought the pills..My name is Fiorella Clayton after 8 years I am pregnant again! I decide to buy this product cause I think it’s excelent and for the quality also I read some great reviews! I try the pills for 3 days..The pills makes me feel really bad palpitations in my heart and increased my heart blood pressure.I don’t know if I am allergic for a component,supplement or any ingredient of the pills! I never have this experience in my 1 pregnancy with other pills! Probably this pills is not for everybody ..
customer_reviews.author: todd clayton

customer_reviews.title: Lose dosage, high impact.
customer_reviews.text: These are high quality with no fillers that I can see, which makes it so the recommended dosage is only 2/day! All organic! I use these for pre-conception, pregnancy, and post-natal. I feel healthy and more energetic when I take these.
customer_reviews.author: Krista W.

customer_reviews.title: Good ingredients but needs a change!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t finish these ! I’m a breastfeeding mama and wanted quality but these taste horrible for the split second they rest on the tongue before swallowing with a drink. Very sour and bitter ! Pills are extremely large too! Way bigger then the prenatals I’ve taken in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Estrella

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy to swallow, bio-available
customer_reviews.text: These are quality vitamins. I can see a real difference in my skin when I take them. My 22 month old is still nursing and in the 50 percentile for weight and 75 for height. Although every child grows differently and at unique rates, I feel that these vitamins give him a “boost”.
customer_reviews.author: T. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: No nausea due to this prenatal!
customer_reviews.text: I love these prenatals! Before, I would get SO sick with standard prenatals and once I began these, I wasn't sick afterwards. They helped so much! I struggle getting past the taste, but if you take it with something sweet to drink it helps. The yucky taste doesn't last long and it is worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Anna P.

customer_reviews.title: big pills but more natural than most
customer_reviews.text: I hate how big these pills are as I am terrible at swallowing them. however, this is the second pregnancy I'm taking them because I trust the brand and feel comfortable with the ingredients. I took them while breastfeeding my first as well and they definitely got the job done. it's nice to take only 2 instead of 4 like the original formula.
customer_reviews.author: LiatBM

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves these
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves these vitamins. Has never had any issues with low counts on anything in the last few pregnancies she has taken them. They are a bit intense so food is required for her when taking them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Can barely taste the flavor. If you’re not a pill drinker you may have to consider it. These pills are large and you may have difficulty. You have to take twice a day. No side effects for me thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Good ingredients!
customer_reviews.text: I chose these prenatals because of the more organic ingredients. I've been taking them for a while year now. I love all the ingredients and will continue to take them. But for me they are hard to swallow and have a slight nasty taste to them. But I will still continue to take them, they are the best prenatals!
customer_reviews.author: Taisa S.

customer_reviews.title: Quality, affordable, and easy on the stomach
customer_reviews.text: I decided to go with this brand of prenatal vitamins after a lot of research and trial and error. Most prenatals I had a hard time digesting. This one is food based and has folate not folic acid which was exactly what I was looking for. I can take these any time of day and on an empty stomach or with a few crackers and my stomach has been fine. I would recommend adding a quality dha while pregnant or trying to conceive, as this does not have dha.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Super easy on the stomach! Great prenatal  vitamin!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the only prenatal vitamins that dont make me sick!! I love that i can take them any time of the day or night with or without food. They are a little big but easy to swallow. They taste gross..Almost like a bitter vitamin C tablet or an Iron pill but you only taste it when you dont take it fast with water or juice. Love love love these pills. ill continue to take even after the baby is here.
customer_reviews.author: lay

customer_reviews.title: I love these prenatals
customer_reviews.text: I love these prenatals! I began taking Baby & Me while ttc and am now 23 weeks pregnant and continue to take them. I'm not sure if these have anything to do with the fact that I have had absolutely no negative pregnancy symptoms (no morning sickness, no constipation, no headaches, etc.), but I will continue to take them because they work really well for me!
customer_reviews.author: Melani Eguino

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pregnancy and lactation support
customer_reviews.text: Have been taking this since early 2017 - through 2 pregnancies as well as after for lactation support purposes. Excellent ingredients and i do believe it assists in the development of baby and successful lactation- whether successful means a couple of ounces a day or 100 oz a day to you- i think it's helpful for the quality of whatever mik you produce.
customer_reviews.author: SB mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I hate pills of any kind so didn't care for the taste of these or the size. But they were packed with great ingredients and I took them throughout my pregnancy and it was great! Neither I or my baby girl were deficient in anything and had a wonderful pregnancy, labor and post partum!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these prenatals!
customer_reviews.text: I can take these on a empty stomach without any icky feeling, I am super sensitive to vitamins (especially pregnant). I'm on my second jar of these ones and I really love them!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Methylated folate and reasonable Vit A level, and iron. No DHA included . These qualities were difficult to find in one vitamin. I take separate vegan dha.
customer_reviews.author: SARL86

customer_reviews.title: They dont make me sick, great for mommy and baby.
customer_reviews.text: Love these vitamins, i read up on vitamins and minerals we need during pregnancy and this had it. (I also take a calcium and dha on the side) I read many reviews it is a little pricier then store bought but worth it when you compare. Only vitamins that did not upset my stomach they are a little big but not really an issue for me. I take one in the day and one in the afternoon. Im on my second bottle and will be using these for my entire pregnancy.
customer_reviews.author: Libby

customer_reviews.title: My favorite prenatal!
customer_reviews.text: Megafood's Baby & Me 2 is the best prenatal you will find. It does not have any strong smells (you know like the cheaper brands) and the ingredients are organic. This can be taken on an empty stomach too! Which is great because when you're nauseous you can't have a prenatal that you have a hard time taking!
customer_reviews.author: Laurel

customer_reviews.title: Great price and good value
customer_reviews.text: They are a lot better than the vitamin code. They are quite BIG!!!but easy to swallow and there is not need to worry about getting enough goodness this has everything you need
customer_reviews.author: M. L.

customer_reviews.title: Strong scent/flavor
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited for this prenatal because of the ingredient list. Unfortunately, during pregnancy I am extremely sensitive to taste and my gag reflex is amplified. I had an extreme difficult time swallowing these because of the flavor. I found a few tricks, but it was a task each day. Ultimately, that was specific to me and my sensitivity. Don’t blame the product at all, though I do wish the flavor could have been less strong.
customer_reviews.author: Casey R

customer_reviews.title: Natural vitamins
customer_reviews.text: I love that this has methylfolate. I buy it regularly for preconception and during pregnancy. The pills get discolored over time but the manufacturer assures me they're still good. To prevent it, I buy the one month bottles now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly inaccurate ingredient listing
customer_reviews.text: I switched to this brand because I wanted to avoid the herbal supplements. I was very happy with the 800mcg folate listed in the pictures of the product. Much to my surprise, the composition of ingredients on the actual bottle is NOT the same as that listed on the page... My bottle lasts 600mcg of folate and different quantities for almost everything else too...
customer_reviews.author: Ross Granowski

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t do it
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when I first found out I was pregnant. They taste like carrots or v8 juice but made me feel nauseous every time I had to take one. So I ended up getting a prescription through my doctor and paying $4 for a 30 day supply.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sour
customer_reviews.text: I’m only here to say OMG they are SOUR! Beware, I just took my first set and just about shot them across the room LoL!
customer_reviews.author: Jonny & Jessica

customer_reviews.title: A constant repurchase!
customer_reviews.text: I was taking a different prenatal with my first pregnancy, switched to these halfway through, took them for over a year while I breastfed, and again with my second pregnancy. I have zero complaints and I feel great about putting these in my body and having them help my babies grow!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Well, I’ll start will saying my sister LOvES these prenatal vitamins! She says it’s her favorite! So she told me to buy and to start taking for my first pregnancy! 😱 I am so happy and I hope that my baby comes out healthy!
customer_reviews.author: Alina Moore

customer_reviews.title: Works Quickly
customer_reviews.text: The best multi. Doesn’t make me sick. Also within a 3 day period of taking it, makes my nails immediately stronger. I’ve went off it, and my nails go paper thin. 3 days after I go on it, they get strong again. Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Lenaa

customer_reviews.title: Breastfeeding vitamins
customer_reviews.text: I needed vitamins for our breastfeeding journey and read so many reviews and checked so many ingredients. I chose these and i am very happy!
customer_reviews.author: S.K.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. Not too big. Easy to swallow even if you’re a little nauseous. The amount of folate is great and not easy to find.
customer_reviews.author: molly

customer_reviews.title: I like the tangy/sourish kinda taste to the tongue.
customer_reviews.text: I've only used for a short while but I like them not for any reason but that my pee isn't too coloured! Addition: My pee is not coloured at all with these maybe there absorbtion is much higher who knows
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Clean ingredients, helped with energy
customer_reviews.text: Clean ingredients, no nasty fillers or binders. Able to take without any stomach upset. Nutritional values are excellent. I suggest taking with a wild omega 3, Vitamin D3 and magnesium/calcium especially while breastfeeding.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these while nursing my first child and now while pregnant with my second. I feel strong and healthy so I’m assuming these do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Nicki

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Since taking their blood builder and now Baby & Me 2 supplement, I no longer have anemia. My baby has met every milestone and I have had minimal pregnancy difficulties as far as constipation, lethargy, etc. I believe some of this is due to the supplements
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Jagdeo

customer_reviews.title: Love these, no complaints!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. They're on the larger side size-wise, but not unmanageable. They have a decent, organic-y smell/taste that hasn't bothered me. I started on these about 6 months prior to becoming pregnant. Luckily, I never had issues with morning sickness or nausea, so these vitamins were never an issue for me to take and I never experienced any negative side effects!
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: My stars don’t probably equate to the overall review- but what pill is easy to swallow?? They did great, and love that they are natural ingredients rather than lab developed molecules.
customer_reviews.author: laura Appleby

product_meta.title: MegaFood, Baby & Me 2, Prenatal and Postnatal Vitamin with Active Form of Folic Acid, Iron, Choline, Non-GMO, 60 Tablets (30 Day Supply)
feature_bullets: MADE WITH REAL FOOD: Foods like organic carrots and oranges, broccoli and brown rice are paired with vitamins or minerals to deliver consistent nutrient potency
DOCTOR-FORMULATED: Formulated by Tieraona Low Dog, M.D., award-winning physician and women’s health expert, to meet the specific needs of women during conception and pregnancy stages
OPTIMAL PRENATAL SUPPORT: 600 mcg of methylfolate (the active form of folic acid) and 300 mg of choline for fetal health, 18 mg of a gentle iron supports pregnancy needs; plus active Vitamin B6
CAN BE TAKEN ON AN EMPTY STOMACH: Take 2 tablets any time of day, even on an empty stomach, so you can feel your very best
OBSESSED WITH QUALITY: Non-GMO Project Verified, vegetarian, tested for 125+ herbicides & pesticides, certified gluten, dairy, soy and glyphosate residue free, Certified Kosher, Certified B Corp
